title: Use external data in user options
content:
External data dynamic options allow you to populate dropdown fields with real-time data from external systems. It enables you to view and select current values from third-party systems when creating or updating records in Service Management.

The key benefits of external data user options are:
  • Real-time data: access up-to-date values from external systems at the moment of selection
  • Seamless integration: leverage Integration Studio to connect to any external data source
  • Enhanced user experience: fast, searchable dropdowns with up to 1,000 displayed items

Use cases

  • Select organizations stored in external CRM systems
  • Choose devices or assets from external inventory management tools
  • Pick values from external configuration management databases (CMDBs)
  • Reference data from any third-party system accessible via Integration Studio

Configuration steps

Prerequisites

Before configuring external data fields, ensure you have:

  1. administrator access: permissions to configure User Options
  2. an Integration Studio scenario: a synchronous scenario that returns data in the required format
  3. an integration setup: an active Integration Studio integration connected to your external system

User Options configuration

User Options with external data are ideal for Service Catalog offerings, allowing you to select values from external systems when submitting requests.

For example, to configure user options for an offering, perform the following steps:

  1. Navigate to User Options.

  • Go to Plan > Service Catalog > Offerings.
  • Select an offering and click User Options.

  1. Add a new User Option.

  • Click Add Field.
  • Set Field Type to String.

  1. Enable External Data.

  • Check the External Data checkbox.

  1. Configure the integration.

  • Integration: select your Integration Studio integration.
  • Scenario: choose a synchronous scenario.

  1. Add parameters (optional).

  • Define scenario input parameters as needed.
  • Use DSL expressions to create dynamic, context-aware dropdowns.

  1. Click Save.

  2. Test in Service Portal.

  • Open Service Portal.
  • Navigate to the offering with the configured user option.
  • Expand the field to see external data loaded in real-time.

Usage: how fields work at runtime

User experience

When a user interacts with a field configured with external data:

  1. Field display

  • The field appears as a searchable dropdown (similar to an entity picker)
  • No data is loaded until the user focuses on the field

  1. Data fetching

  • When the field is clicked or focused, Service Management triggers the Integration Studio scenario
  • A loading indicator displays: "Searching..."
  • Data is retrieved in real-time from the external system

  1. Viewing results

  • Up to 1,000 items are displayed by default
  • If more than 1,000 items exist, you need to search for the desired item

  1. Searching

  • Use the search box to filter items (case-insensitive substring search)
  • Search returns matching items dynamically from the full dataset

  1. Selecting a value

  • Click on an item to select it
  • The selected value is saved as a string in the Service Management field
  • The value persists and can be viewed later by other users

Display format

External data can be displayed in two formats:

  • Value only: The system displays only the value field retrieved by the Integration Studio scenario.
  • Value - Extended Display: If the scenario returns both value and extendedDisplay, the dropdown shows: value - extendedDisplay.
    For example: ID1234 - 275 Frank Tompa Drive

Error handling

If data cannot be retrieved, the field displays an error message:

  • Agent/Service Portal: "No results due to server error"
  • Mobile App: "Failed to load data"

The common causes of these errors are:

  1. Scenario timeout (maximum 30 seconds)
  2. Scenario execution error
  3. External system unavailable

Advanced: field dependencies with parameters

You can create dependent fields where the values in one field depend on the selection of another field.

Use case example: Location and Building.

Scenario: You want users to first select a Location, then see only Buildings that belong to that Location.

Configuration:

  1. Field 1: Location 

  • External Data: Enabled
  • Scenario: GetLocations (returns all locations)

  1. Field 2: Building 

  • External Data: Enabled
  • Scenario: GetBuildingsByLocation (returns buildings filtered by location)
  • Parameter:
    • Name: locationId
    • Type: DSL
    • Value: ${entity.Location} (references Field 1)

User experience:

  1. User selects "Waterloo" from the Location dropdown.
  2. User clicks the Building dropdown.
  3. The scenario is triggered with parameter locationId = "Waterloo".
  4. Only office buildings in Waterloo are displayed.
  • When the parent field value changes, the dependent field value is not automatically cleared.
  • Use Business Rules if you need to reset dependent field values when parent fields change automatically.
  • External data retrieved in the fields is cached for 10 to 20 seconds to reduce the number of calls made to external systems.
  • Because of the caching node, in the dependent field scenario, if a user quickly switches between fields, the data for the dependent field (in the parameterized Integration Studio case) is not refreshed with external data.

Integration Studio: scenario requirements

External data fields require synchronous scenarios only. Asynchronous scenarios are not supported.

Timeout

Maximum execution time is 30 seconds. You can configure timeout at the scenario level in Integration Studio. Note that scenario timeout is overwritten by the Integration Studio timeout defined in the Suite Administration. For more information, see Administer Integration Studio. If the scenario exceeds the timeout, the system displays an error.

Input parameters (optional)

Scenarios can accept zero or more input parameters defined during field configuration:

  • Parameters are passed as key-value pairs
  • Support both constant values and DSL expressions
  • Use parameters to filter data or customize scenario behavior

Required output format

The scenario must return a JSON response in the following format:

{
  "data": [
    {
      "value": "ID1234",
      "extendedDisplay": "Waterloo"
    },
    {
      "value": "ID5678",
      "extendedDisplay": "Toronto"
    }
  ]
}
If the response is either {} or {data:null}, then you will encounter one of the error messages listed in the Troubleshooting section.

Field definitions

Field Required Description
value Yes The actual value to be stored in the Service Management field when selected
extendedDisplay No Optional descriptive text displayed alongside the value in the dropdown

Display rules

  • If only value is provided: display shows value
  • If both value and extendedDisplay are provided: display shows value - extendedDisplay
  • If only extendedDisplay is provided: an error is shown.

Sample scenario logic

  1. Receive input parameters (if any).
  2. Connect to an external system API.
  3. Retrieve data based on parameters or default filters.
  4. Transform data into the required JSON format: 
  • Map external field to "value"
  • Map additional description to "extendedDisplay" (optional)
  1. Return JSON response with "data" array.

Best practices

  • Performance: optimize scenarios to return results in under 10 seconds for the best user experience
  • Data volume: return only necessary data; users can search if the dataset is large
  • Testing: test scenarios with various input parameters before deploying to production
     
  • To enhance query efficiency and maximize data retrieval, use DSL to transform your data before execution.
  • You can use built-in actions such as Apply to Each or Do Until; however, they introduce additional processing latency and constrain overall data retrieval throughput.

Supported interfaces

External data fields are supported across all Service Management interfaces:

Interface Supported Notes
Agent Interface ✓ User friendly dropdown with search
Service Portal ✓ User friendly dropdown with search
Mobile App (iOS/Android) ✓ Optimized mobile experience with pull-to-refresh

Interface-specific features

Agent Interface and Service Portal:

  • Seamless dropdown experience for users
  • Loading spinners and error messages with icons
  • Three-line text trimming for long values

Mobile App:

  • Pull-to-refresh to reload external data
  • Previous selection highlighted when reopening the picker
  • Optimized for mobile screen sizes

Searching within dropdowns

When the dropdown is open:

  • Type in the search box to filter displayed items
  • Search is case-insensitive
  • Matches any item where the search term appears (substring search)
  • Search applies to both value and extendedDisplay fields

Key information

  • Single value only: multi-select is not supported
  • Maximum display: 1,000 items are shown by default (search to find additional items)
  • Text fields only: supported for String field types
  • No default value from External Data: default values cannot be dynamically loaded from external systems.
    User Options default values are supported.
  • User Options filtering: not supported in entity filters
  • Cannot combine: External Data and Federated attributes on the same field

Troubleshooting

Common issues

Issue Possible cause Solution
"No results due to server error" Scenario timeout or execution error Check Integration Studio execution logs; optimize scenario performance
"Failed to load data" (Mobile) Network issue or scenario failure Retry by pulling down to refresh; check connectivity
No values displayed Scenario returns empty data array Verify external system has data; check scenario logic
Wrong values displayed Scenario returning incorrect format Verify JSON output matches required format (value and optional extendedDisplay)
Field shows as text box External Data disabled or toggled off Enable External Data checkbox in field configuration

Debugging steps

  1. Check Integration Studio logs.

  • Go to Integration Studio > Scenario Executions.
  • Find the execution triggered by the field.
  • Review input parameters and output.

  1. Verify scenario output.

  • Ensure the scenario returns valid JSON.
  • Confirm data array contains objects with value field.

  1. Test scenario independently.

  • Run the scenario manually in Integration Studio.
  • Verify it completes within 30 seconds.
  • Check that output format is correct.

  1. Review permissions.

  • Ensure users have appropriate entity permissions (CREATE or UPDATE).
  • Verify Integration Studio integration is active.
